t: Romans 10
The Word of Faith Brings Salvation
Brethren,*p my heart’s desire and my prayer to God for them is for their*i salvation.
For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not in accordance with knowledge.
For not knowing about God’s righteousness and seeking to establish their own, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.
For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
For*p Moses writes that the man who practices the righteousness which is based on law shall live by that righteousness.
But the righteousness based on faith speaks as follows: “Do*s not*s say*s in*s your*s heart,*s ‘Who*s will*s ascend*s into*s heaven?’*s (that is, to bring Christ down),
or ‘Who*s will*s descend*s into*s the*s abyss?’*s (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).”
But what does it say? “The*s word*s is*s near*s you,*s in*s your*s mouth*s and*s in*s your*s heart*s ”—that is, the word of faith which we are preaching,
that if you confess with your mouth Jesus as*i Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved;
for with the heart a person believes, resulting in righteousness, and with the mouth he confesses, resulting in salvation.
For the Scripture says, “Whoever*s believes*s in*s Him*s will*s not*s be*s disappointed.”*s
For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek; for the same Lord*i is Lord of all, abounding in riches for all who call on Him;
for “Whoever*s will*s call*s on*s the*s name*s of*s the*s Lord*s will*s be*s saved.”*s
How*p then will they call on Him in whom they have not believed? How will they believe in Him whom they have not heard? And how will they hear without a preacher?
How will they preach unless they are sent? Just as it is written, “How*s beautiful*s are*s the*s feet*s of*s those*s who*s bring*s good*s news*s of*s good*s things!”*s
However,*p they did not all heed the good news; for Isaiah says, “Lord,*s who*s has*s believed*s our*s report?”*s
So faith comes*i from hearing, and hearing by the word of Christ.
But*p I say, surely they have never heard, have they? Indeed they have; “Their*spn voice*s has*s gone*s out*s into*s all*s the*s earth,*s And*ln their*s words*s to*s the*s ends*s of*s the*s world.”*s

But*p I say, surely Israel did not know, did they? First Moses says, “I*pn will*s make*s you*s jealous*s by*s that*s which*s is*s not*s a*s nation,*s By*sln a*s nation*s without*s understanding*s will*s I anger*s you.”*s
And*p Isaiah is very bold and says, “I*pn was*s found*s by*s those*s who*s did*s not*s seek*s Me,*s I*ln became*s manifest*s to*s those*s who*s did*s not*s ask*s for*s Me.”*s
But*p as for Israel He says, “All the*s day*s long*s I have*s stretched*s out*s My*s hands*s to*s a*s disobedient*s and*s obstinate*s people.”*s
